body_html:
Thanks @Pouyan-Jahangiri for the graph. I was able to give it a try, and it appears the utf-8 error happens when the input graph is binary format, but the script is expecting a text format protobuf.
To fix that, pass in --input_binary=true to the command line. For example:
bazel-bin/tensorflow/python/tools/freeze_graph --input_graph=/tmp/Cymax_graph.pb --input_checkpoint=/tmp/model.ckpt-50 --output_graph=/tmp/cymax_frozen.pb --output_node_names=MergeSummary/MergeSummary --input_binary=true
body_text:
Thanks @Pouyan-Jahangiri for the graph. I was able to give it a try, and it appears the utf-8 error happens when the input graph is binary format, but the script is expecting a text format protobuf.
To fix that, pass in --input_binary=true to the command line. For example:
bazel-bin/tensorflow/python/tools/freeze_graph --input_graph=/tmp/Cymax_graph.pb --input_checkpoint=/tmp/model.ckpt-50 --output_graph=/tmp/cymax_frozen.pb --output_node_names=MergeSummary/MergeSummary --input_binary=true
body:
Thanks @Pouyan-Jahangiri for the graph. I was able to give it a try, and it appears the utf-8 error happens when the input graph is binary format, but the script is expecting a text format protobuf.
To fix that, pass in `--input_binary=true` to the command line. For example:
`bazel-bin/tensorflow/python/tools/freeze_graph --input_graph=/tmp/Cymax_graph.pb --input_checkpoint=/tmp/model.ckpt-50 --output_graph=/tmp/cymax_frozen.pb --output_node_names=MergeSummary/MergeSummary --input_binary=true`
